@harrybr Iâ€™d still move away from thinking about storing the â€œinsightâ€ to storing the solution. Could be documented as backlog of issues to fix, but the key is that addressing it should include taking that card away from backlog.
@harrybr Most findings from usability testing can be fixed faster than they can be fully documented, and become irrelevant when the design is updated.

@harrybr Itâ€™s REALLY hard to find what and how to store as insight. What is the right granularity? Whatâ€™s the shelf life? Are there really ever green insights? How do you keep them fresh? (Require them to be reviewed periodically, NHS style?)
